title: Eight Balochistan engineers sent to Argentina for training - Pakistan - DAWN.COM
content:
QUETTA: As part of the educational development initiative under the Reko Diq copper-cum-gold project, eight engineers belonging to different area of Balochistan were sent to Argentina for an 18-month training programme under the International Graduate Development Programme.

The engineers will receive hands-on professional training at Barrick Mining Corporation’s Veladero Project.

A spokesperson for the Barrick Mining Corporation said here on Sunday that initiative reflects Reko Diq mining company’s commitment to empowering local youth by providing them with access to international-standard education and professional development.

The goal is to make these engineers a valuable asset for the nation and they could contribute meaningfully to future operations of the Reko Diq project.

This is the third group of engineers which has been sent abroad for professional training under the programme. Earlier, two groups comprising nine to ten engineers each were sent to Argentina and Zambia for training in the mining sector.

The spokesperson said this practical experience will provide the engineers with exposure to world-class modern mining operations and help them acquire essential skills and expertise in their respective field.

Published in Dawn, May 19th, 2025
